To configure your Wozart device, make sure it is powered ON.\nClick “Connect” below and connect to the Wi-Fi network WozartXXXXXXXXX.\nOnce connected, press the back button to return to the Wozart app.

Turn your home to a connected home seamlessly.
4. Tap “Connect” and select ‘Wozart Switch-XXXXXX’ from the Wi-Fi list.
5. On the next screen tap “Configure Wi-Fi”.
6. Click “Configure” and type in “auraswitch” (without spaces) in the pin field.
6. Select your home Wi-Fi network, type in password and click “Connect”.
8. Select “Wozart Device” you want to configure and input the provided 8 digit USC (Unique Setup Code) of the device.
9. Configure Appliances by Name, Location/Room, Favourite, Dimmable, Icons and click “Finish”.

In the edit scene screen, customize scene by name,icon and also add/remove loads.
To delete the scene, tap ”Delete” at bottom of the screen.

Automate your accessories to turn on or off when you arrive or leave your home.
7. Give a name to the Automation and choose if you want automation to occur when People Arrive or People Leave your home.
8. Set the radius for Geo-Fence of your home and then tap ”Add”.
9. Select the time for the automation; during on the day, night and between specific time and tap ”Next”.
10. Select the loads you want to automate and tap “Next”.
11. Adjust status of the loads to your preference and then tap ”Done”.

Control connected devices with voice using Google Assistant. Just start by Saying “Ok Google” to turn an appliance on or off, set your scenes and dim your lights.
Download and install the Google Home app.
1. At the top Left, tap + > Set up device > Have something already setup?
2. Tap on plus icon on the right bottom of the screen.
4. You will be redirected to login page, login with the same mail ID registered with Wozart.
5. On successful login, all your connected loads associated with Wozart account are listed.
6. You can choose names to call your connected loads and also assign them to rooms in a home for more convenient control.
7. Use simple voice commands to control your connected appliances.
Control connected devices with voice using Amazon Alexa. Ask Alexa to turn an appliance on or off, set your scenes.
Download and install Amazon Alexa app.
3. Tap “ENABLE TO USE” and you will be redirected to a login page.
4. Login with the same mail ID registered with Wozart.
5. Tap “DISCOVER DEVICES” and wait for discovery to complete.
6. On successful discovery, connected devices will list under Devices and scenes under Scenes in the Smart Home section of the Amazon Alexa app.
7. Tap on a load to assign name and room according to your preference.
8. Repeat the above step for all the loads.
9. Once configured use simple voice commands and control all your connected appliances.
With SmartThings, you can control, monitor and automate a wide range of connected devices in your home.
Download and install SmartThings app on your mobile device.
3. Tap “Switch/Dimmer”, you will be redirected to login page.
4. Login with the same mail ID registered with Wozart.
5. Click “X” on the top left corner to finish login.
6. All connected loads will be listed, Tap “Done”.
7. Now you can control all your connected appliances using SmartThings.
Wozart is your smart home partner. With Wozart you can easily monitor, control and automate your home from just about anywhere in the world.
What can I do with Wozart?

Control:
You can control or check the status of connected electrical appliances and lights from the app. Perfect for those times when you’re not sure if the lights are left on or the door is locked.

Scenes:
Scenes let you control multiple appliances with a tap in the app. For Example, a “Good Night” scene could be created to turn off all the lights, close the curtains, adjust temperature on the AC to your preference all at once.

Schedules:
Want your lights to turn on or off at specific time of the day? You can create a schedule with in the app for single or multiple devices to turn to a specific setting for a time of the day. Attend to important things in your life while Aura takes care of your home.

Location-Based Triggers:
With Wozart installed, Your Home can sense when you arrive or leave and prepare itself as per your preference. You can automatically trigger appliances and lights based on your geo-location. You can have all the house lights and Air Conditioners turn off once you cross a pre-set distance say 500 m from your home.

Add members:
You can now invite your family and friends to share the joy of connected living. It is as easy as sending an email.
Which Mobile platforms does Wozart support?
Wozart currently supports Android 5.0 or later and iOS 10.0 or later. Wozart App is available for download from Google Play and App Store.
Can I access Wozart from my Computer,mobile web or browser-based platform?

No, We currently support apps for iPhone, iPod touch, iPad, Apple Watch, other apple devices, Android Mobile and Android wear. You can also voice control Wozart products using Amazon Alexa, Google Home, Siri or Bixby powered devices. Wozart products can also be controlled from Apple Home app on iOS, SmartThings, Google Home and Alexa Apps.
Does Wozart work with Amazon Alexa?
Yes, We have partnered with Amazon Alexa so you can voice control all your connected appliances from all Alexa powered devices.
Does Wozart work with Google Home?
Yes, We have partnered with Google Home so you can voice control all your connected appliances from all Google Assistant powered devices

Yes, We have partnered with SmartThings so you can voice control all your connected appliances from Bixby powered smart devices. You can also use SmartThings app to control, monitor Wozart connected devices with other smart home products.

SmartThings is a Smart home platform by Samsung. It connects wirelessly with a wide range of smart devices and makes them work together. SmartThings allows you to monitor, control, and automate a wide range of connected devices in your home. For example, you can set connected lights to turn on and off at the touch of a button, at the same time each day, when you open doors and windows, when motion is detected in your home, or when you say “Turn on the Living room lights".
Does Wozart work with Apple HomeKit?
Yes, Wozart products are compatible with Apple HomeKit so you can control all connected appliances from Home app or voice control using Siri on all Apple devices.

HomeKit is a new framework for home automation developed by Apple. HomeKit technology provides an easy, secure way to control HomeKit-enabled accessories using Siri on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch etc. HomeKit certification ensures that all accessories will work together flawlessly. You can also integrate third-party smart products that “Works with Apple HomeKit” with Wozart without any hassle.
Can I control my devices remotely?
Yes, You can control, monitor and automate your Wozart products from the Wozart app from just about anywhere in the world provided you are connected to the internet.

Scenes can be created in Wozart app and let you control multiple devices with one tap. For example, a “Good Night” scene could be created to turn off all the lights, close the curtains, adjust temperature on the AC to your preference all at once.
To create scenes refer to “How to add scene”
You can create a schedule with in the Wozart app for single or multiple devices to turn on/off at a time of the day. Attend to important things in your life while Wozart takes care of your home.

A Favourite device is the one you use frequently and need to have in the Home tab of the app. In case you want to add/remove any device from the Home tab, touch and hold the device to open edit screen and then enable/disable “Add to Favourite” field.

A Favourite Scene is the one you use frequently and need to have in the Home tab of the app. In case you want to add/remove any scene from the Home tab, touch and hold the tile to open edit screen and then enable/disable “Add to Favourite” field.
What happens if my internet connection goes down?

All Wozart products and Wozart app support local control. With this you can control all your connected devices even if the internet goes down, as long as your phone is connected to your home Wi-Fi network

When the controller device (phone, tablet etc.) and Wozart device are connected to the same Wi-Fi network, they communicate with each other with router acting as a bridge. This is called local control.
When the controller device and Wozart device are not connected to the same Wi-Fi network, they communicate through cloud servers and that is called remote/cloud control.
What happens if my Wi-Fi is down?

Wozart app and devices require Wi-Fi to connect and communicate with each other. Even if you lose connection with a Wi-Fi router, you will still be able to manually control your devices. Once the Wi-Fi network is restored, Wozart devices will reconnect automatically.
Do I need to pay a subscription to use Wozart?
No, Wozart app is completely free to use. You only need to buy Wozart products.
Does it cost me to control my products remotely?
No, Wozart app is free to download and use.
Do I need to change my Switchboard?
No, Wozart products are designed to fit perfectly in the space behind a standard Switchboard.
How do I connect Wozart to a new router or what happens if I make changes to my Wi-Fi network name or password?
You have to get Wozart device in to set-up mode. To Factory reset the device, toggle the switch connected to second load eight times under 5 sec.
Do Wozart products require extra wiring?
No, Wozart products do not require any kind of additional wiring and seamlessly integrate with your existing switchboards.
Would my existing physical switches work?
Yes, They function normally. When you control the loads manually it reflects on the app.
Do I need any additional smart hubs to control my appliances?
No, Wozart products communicate directly with your home Wi-Fi router and doesn\'t require additional hubs.
Will the device fit behind my existing switch board?
Yes, Wozart products are meticulously designed to fit perfectly behind standard Indian switchboard.
Will Wozart products reconnect after power failure?
Once the Wi-Fi network is up after power comes back ON, Wozart products will connect and can be controlled using smart devices.
Can I integrate other products with Wozart?
Wozart can be integrated with any home automation device that has “Works with Apple HomeKit” or “Works with SmartThings” badge on the packaging.
Will Wozart Devices connect to a 5GHz network?
Wozart products will only connect and work with 2.4 GHz network. In case you are using dual-band routers ensure both the networks have different SSID (name) or switch off the 5GHz band.
What do I do if the Wozart product is offline?

First ensure, the Wi-Fi network is working normally. In case, there are no problems with the network, normal reset the device and check if it is connected back. "Even then," if the problem persist, factory reset and configure the device again and also get the Wi-Fi router closer or add a Wi-Fi repeater near to the device.
If I encounter issues with a Wozart product or app whom should I contact?
If I have any other queries whom should I contact?
Please mail your queries to info@wozart.com
Why does Wozart swicth occasionally get disconnected from the network?

This may be due to either network interference or network congestion. Please ensure you are on 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi. In case you are using dual-band routers, ensure both the networks have different SSID (name) or switch off the 5GHz band
Please note: Traditional 2.4 GHz band reach up to 150 feet (46m) indoors and 300 feet (92m) outdoors.
Make sure the number of Wi-Fi connected devices is within wireless network capacity form your router. Otherwise, please replace or add an additional router.
Reconnect your smart devices to Wi-Fi and make sure your Wi-Fi signal is strong enough.
Wait until the network is fixed if your router performs poorly in wireless networks that might result from network congestion.
Check the router settings and see if there is any limit to the number of simultaneous connections.
Restart or restore your Wozart Aura devices to factory settings, and add devices.
Update the firmware to the latest version.
Can I share home control with other people?

Yes, you can share the smart-living experience with your near and dear simply by sending an invite entering their email address.\nTo Share access; Home> Settings > Members > tap “+” on the top right corner and enter user email address registered with Wozart.
Can I revoke access to my home to members in the Wozart app?
Yes, The Master user can revoke access of shared members. Go to Settings > Members > Select user > Revoke Access
Can a guest user exit from a shared Home?
Yes, Go to Home > Settings > Members > Select user > Revoke Access.
Who is a Master user in a home?
Master user of the home is the person who has created the home and configured Wozart devices. He/She can add or remove users from the Home.
Is there a limit to number of Guest users?
No, There is no limit to the number of Guest users for a home.
What access does Wozart have to my products?

Wozart can see the devices you have paired to your account, the firmware version you are running, the names you have assigned to your devices. We don’t have access to any passwords you have set on your Wi-Fi or on the App.
How can I ensure my products are secure and up-to-date?

Wozart is constantly testing and auditing the security of our and our partners platforms. We make frequent updates to the Wozart app and devices to ensure you have the latest security. Always update your smart devices when new software or firmware is available. These updates not only give you latest functionality but keep your products secure.
Verify open/close action.\n Tap on “Test” button to verify.

From Android 6.0 Marshmallow onwards the application requires Location permission in order to scan for Bluetooth Low Energy devices. \n\nThis is because Bluetooth LE beacons, for example iBeacons or Eddystone, may be used to determine the phone\'s and user\'s location. nRF Mesh Provisioner will not use this information in any way.
The Bluetooth adapter is turned off. Click the button below to enable it.
1. Make sure the DK is turned on and is connected to a power source using a micro USB cable or a coin cell is plugged in. \n\n2. Make sure the relevant firmware and SoftDevice are flashed.

3. Location is turned off. Some Android phones require it enabled in order to scan for Bluetooth LE devices. If you are sure your Node is advertising and it doesn\'t show up here, click the button below to enable Location.
